fertilizers.name: Wiggle Worm Soil Builder Worm Castings
fertilizers.application: Mix 1–2 cups per square foot into soil or sprinkle around plants monthly. For seedlings, use 1 tbsp per pot.

fertilizers.name: Dr. Earth Organic 5 Tomato, Vegetable & Herb Fertilizer
fertilizers.application: For young plants (<6 months), mix 1 tbsp per gallon water, apply biweekly. For mature plants, use 1/2 cup per plant every 2 months.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, fish bone meal-based. Half-dose for young plants prevents burn

fertilizers.name: Espoma Organic Plant-Tone Plant Food
fertilizers.application: Sprinkle 1/4 cup per plant monthly, or mix into soil at planting (1 lb per 25 sq ft). Water thoroughly after application.

fertilizers.name: Jobe’s Organics All-Purpose Granular Fertilizer
fertilizers.application: Mix 1–2 tbsp per plant every 4–6 weeks during growing season. For new plants, use 1 tsp to avoid over-fertilization.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, feather meal-based. Half-dose for young plants ensures safety

fertilizers.name: Neptune’s Harvest Fish & Seaweed Fertilizer (Liquid)
fertilizers.application: Mix 1 oz per gallon water, apply as foliar spray or soil drench every 2 weeks. Use 1/2 oz for young plants.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, fish emulsion-based. Apply in evening to reduce odor

fertilizers.name: Milorganite Slow-Release Nitrogen Fertilizer
fertilizers.application: Spread 1 lb per 250 sq ft every 8–10 weeks. For young plants, use 1/2 lb to avoid nitrogen burn.

fertilizers.name: GS Plant Foods Liquid Love All Purpose Natural Plant Food
fertilizers.application: Mix 1/2 oz per gallon water, apply weekly as foliar spray or soil drench. Safe for all plant ages.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, sea kelp-based. Enhances soil microbial activity

fertilizers.name: Miracle-Gro Performance Organics All Purpose Granules
fertilizers.application: Use 1 tbsp per plant every 2–4 weeks, or mix into soil at planting. Use 1/2 tbsp for young plants.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, poultry manure-based. Avoid over-application in hot weather

fertilizers.name: True Organic Lawn Food
fertilizers.application: Spread 1 lb per 100 sq ft every 4–6 weeks. For small gardens, use 1/2 lb to avoid excess nitrogen.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, soybean meal-based. Supports soil health

fertilizers.name: Espoma Bio-Tone Starter Plus
fertilizers.application: Mix 1/4 cup per plant at planting, or sprinkle monthly for established plants. Use 1 tbsp for young transplants.
fertilizers.notes: OMRI-listed, feather meal-based. Promotes root growth

beekeeping.name: Neem Oil
beekeeping.description: Disrupts pest feeding and growth (Varroa mites, aphids, beetles) with azadirachtin
beekeeping.application: Mix 1 tbsp neem oil, 1 tsp castile soap per gallon water. Spray plants near hives or use in traps at dusk. Reapply weekly.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Not safe for bees during foraging; apply in evening. Avoid hive interiors unless approved (e.g., Apiguard).
beekeeping.southeast_texas_relevance: Controls small hive beetles in humid Texas climate

beekeeping.name: Baking Soda
beekeeping.description: Fungicide and mild pesticide for powdery mildew and aphids on plants near hives
beekeeping.application: Mix 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp vegetable oil, 1 tsp soap per gallon water. Spray weekly in cooler hours.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Safe for bees if not sprayed on flowers. Avoid high concentrations.
beekeeping.southeast_texas_relevance: Manages fungal issues in Texas’ humid gardens

beekeeping.name: Insecticidal Soap
beekeeping.description: Kills soft-bodied pests (aphids, mites) by dehydration, used on plants or in hive traps
beekeeping.application: Mix 2 tbsp castile soap per gallon water. Spray pests directly, reapply every 5–7 days.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Harmful on contact; apply in early morning or evening.
beekeeping.southeast_texas_relevance: Protects Texas wildflowers for bee forage

beekeeping.name: Diatomaceous Earth (DE)
beekeeping.description: Dehydrates ants and small hive beetles around hive stands
beekeeping.application: Dust food-grade DE around hive bases or traps. Reapply after rain.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Safe if not applied near hive entrances or flowers
beekeeping.southeast_texas_relevance: Controls ants in Texas’ warm climate

beekeeping.name: Pyrethrin
beekeeping.description: Fast-acting insecticide for wasps and beetles, degrades quickly
beekeeping.application: Mix 20g pyrethrum powder per 10 liters water, spray at dusk. Follow label for commercial products.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Highly toxic to bees on contact; apply late evening

beekeeping.name: Garlic Spray
beekeeping.description: Repels aphids and beetles with sulfur compounds, used on plants near hives
beekeeping.application: Blend 2 garlic bulbs, strain, mix with 1 liter water, 1 tsp soap, 100ml oil. Spray every 5–7 days.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Safe if not sprayed on flowers; avoid hive areas

beekeeping.name: Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt)
beekeeping.description: Kills caterpillar larvae, safe for bees, used on plants near hives
beekeeping.application: Mix 1–2 tsp Bt concentrate per 20 liters water, spray foliage at dusk. Reapply every 7–10 days.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Safe for bees, targets larvae only

beekeeping.name: Essential Oil Sprays (Peppermint, Thyme)
beekeeping.description: Repels ants and wasps around hive exteriors with strong scents
beekeeping.application: Mix 5–7 drops per quart water, spray hive bases weekly.
beekeeping.bee_safety: Safe if not sprayed inside hives; avoid overuse
beekeeping.southeast_texas_relevance: Deters ants in humid Texas climate

general_gardening.name: Neem Oil
general_gardening.description: Controls aphids, spider mites, and beetles with azadirachtin
general_gardening.application: Mix 1–2 tbsp neem oil, 1 tsp castile soap per gallon water. Spray plants every 7–14 days in evening.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Not safe during foraging; apply at dusk
general_gardening.southeast_texas_relevance: Effective on Texas vegetables and ornamentals

general_gardening.name: Baking Soda
general_gardening.description: Controls powdery mildew and repels aphids with alkaline residues
general_gardening.application: Mix 1–2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp oil, 1 tsp soap per gallon water. Spray weekly, avoid midday.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe if not on flowers; avoid overuse
general_gardening.southeast_texas_relevance: Manages fungal issues in Texas gardens

general_gardening.name: Insecticidal Soap
general_gardening.description: Kills aphids, mealybugs, and spider mites by dehydration
general_gardening.application: Mix 2–4 oz castile soap per gallon water, spray pests directly every 5–7 days.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Harmful on contact; apply in evening

general_gardening.name: Diatomaceous Earth (DE)
general_gardening.description: Dehydrates slugs, ants, and cockroaches in garden beds
general_gardening.application: Dust lightly around plants or beds, reapply after rain.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe if not near flowers or hive entrances
general_gardening.southeast_texas_relevance: Controls slugs in Texas’ moist soils

general_gardening.name: Pyrethrin
general_gardening.description: Kills caterpillars, beetles, and flies, degrades in sunlight
general_gardening.application: Mix per label (e.g., 20g powder per 10 liters water), spray at dusk.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Toxic to bees on contact; apply late evening

general_gardening.name: Garlic and Chili Pepper Spray
general_gardening.description: Repels aphids, spider mites, and leafhoppers with sulfur and capsaicin
general_gardening.application: Blend 2 garlic cloves, 1–2 chili peppers, mix with 1 liter water, 1 tsp soap, 100ml oil. Spray every 5–7 days.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe if not sprayed on flowers; avoid edible parts near harvest
general_gardening.southeast_texas_relevance: Effective on Texas crops like okra

general_gardening.name: Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt)
general_gardening.description: Kills caterpillar larvae (e.g., tomato hornworms), safe for most beneficial insects
general_gardening.application: Mix 1–2 tsp per gallon water, spray foliage at dusk every 7–14 days.

general_gardening.name: Essential Oil Spray (Rosemary, Peppermint, Thyme)
general_gardening.description: Repels ants, flies, and mosquitoes with aromatic compounds
general_gardening.application: Mix 10–15 drops oil per quart water. Spray perimeters every 3–5 days.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe if not on flowers; avoid overuse

general_gardening.name: Kaolin Clay
general_gardening.description: Protective barrier deters fruit flies, beetles, and leafhoppers
general_gardening.application: Mix per label (e.g., 1/4–1/2 cup per gallon water), spray to coat plants. Reapply after rain.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe for bees; wash crops before eating
general_gardening.southeast_texas_relevance: Protects Texas fruit trees from leafminers

general_gardening.name: Horticultural Oil
general_gardening.description: Suffocates scale, mites, and aphids by blocking spiracles
general_gardening.application: Mix 2–5 tbsp oil per gallon water, spray in cool weather every 7–14 days.
general_gardening.bee_safety: Safe if applied when bees are not foraging

additional_notes: Soil Testing: Conduct a soil test (available at garden centers or through extension services) to match fertilizers to nutrient needs
OMRI Certification: All products are OMRI-listed or certified for organic use
Bee Safety: Apply pesticides in evening to protect bees, especially in Southeast Texas’ pollinator-rich environment

Organic Practices: Use compost, compost teas, or Real Growers Recharge (https://www.amazon.com/Real-Growers-Recharge-Natural-Stimulant/dp/B00BSRB768) as primary foliar sprays or drenching soil to save costs and boost soil health
